intro: Elatostema bulusanense, commonly known as the Bulusan sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle and related plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
